docs.title: Tutorial Intro
docs.description: Let's discover Docusaurus in less than 5 minutes.

docs.title: Congratulations!
docs.description: You have just learned the basics of Docusaurus and made some changes to the initial template.

docs.title: Create a Blog Post
docs.description: Docusaurus creates a page for each blog post, but also a blog index page, a tag system, an RSS feed...

docs.title: Create a Document
docs.description: Documents are groups of pages connected through:

docs.title: Create a Page
docs.description: Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page:

docs.title: Deploy your site
docs.description: Docusaurus is a static-site-generator (also called Jamstack).

docs.title: Markdown Features
docs.description: Docusaurus supports Markdown and a few additional features.

docs.title: Manage Docs Versions
docs.description: Docusaurus can manage multiple versions of your docs.

link.description: 5 minutes to learn the most important Docusaurus concepts.

metadata.title: Welcome
metadata.description: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.

blogPosts.content:
[Docusaurus blogging features](https://docusaurus.io/docs/blog) are powered by the [blog plugin](https://docusaurus.io/docs/api/plugins/@docusaurus/plugin-content-blog).

Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the `blog` directory.

Regular blog authors can be added to `authors.yml`.

The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as:

- `2019-05-30-welcome.md`
- `2019-05-30-welcome/index.md`

A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images:

![Docusaurus Plushie](./docusaurus-plushie-banner.jpeg)

The blog supports tags as well!

**And if you don't want a blog**: just delete this directory, and use `blog: false` in your Docusaurus config.

metadata.title: MDX Blog Post
metadata.description: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.

blogPosts.content:
Blog posts support [Docusaurus Markdown features](https://docusaurus.io/docs/markdown-features), such as [MDX](https://mdxjs.com/).

:::tip

Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts.

```js
<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>
```

<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>

:::

metadata.title: Long Blog Post
metadata.description: This is the summary of a very long blog post,

blogPosts.content:
This is the summary of a very long blog post,

Use a `<!--` `truncate` `-->` comment to limit blog post size in the list view.

<!--truncate-->

info.title: Cambrion Execution API
info.description: An API to access Cambrion API

externalDocs.description: Find out more about our store
Find out more about our store
Find out more about our store

post.description:
Create an execution from an ID (optional).
If an execution ID is given that ID will be used, otherwise a new one is created. If the execution already
exists, it will be ignored and 204 will be returned. If a new execution was created, 200 is returned with
the execution ID as body.

post.summary: Merge a raw observation into the current observation
post.description: The raw observation is merged into the current observation context.

get.description: Get a full observation of the execution.

post.description: Transform a raw observation into an object using a transformer statement

requestBody.description:
A JSONata object to transform an observation into a custom representation. 
[JSONata Documentation](https://docs.jsonata.org/overview.html)

post.description: Link contents of observation to documents in an index.

200.description: Get list of all available pipelines

get.summary: Get YAML description of a pipeline

400.description: Invalid execution request (i.e. Execution not found!).

post.description: Transform the output observation of a pipeline directly.

requestBody.description:
A JSONata object to transform an observation into a custom representation. 
[JSONata Documentation](https://docs.jsonata.org/overview.html)

get.description: Get a list of all indices.

post.description: Create a new index with an optional schema.

get.description: Get the description of an index. Including the data model if present.

post.description: Create a JSON document in an index. If the index does not exist it will be created automatically.

400.description: Invalid index ID or document ID
Invalid index ID or document ID

ExecutionRequest.description: Execution is the context which holds data related to a specific execution

TransformerResponse.description:
Response of after transformation. The output can be an arbitrary object created by a JSONata
expression. It must be deserialized.

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found

PipelineId.name: pipelineId
PipelineId.description: ID of the pipeline to execute

IndexLimit.name: limit
IndexLimit.description: Limits the number of indices on a page

IndexOffset.name: offset
IndexOffset.description: Specifies the page number of the indices to be displayed

DocumentLimit.name: limit
DocumentLimit.description: Limits the number of documents on a page

DocumentOffset.name: offset
DocumentOffset.description: Specifies the page number of the documents to be displayed

Execution.description:
The execution is a stateful environment
in which media (such as images or PDF files) can be stored an used an inputs for pipelines. The ID
in the request body is optional (generated if empty) and must be unique.

PipelineExecutionObject.description:
The execution is a stateful environment
in which media (such as images or PDF files) can be stored an used an inputs for pipelines. The ID
in the request body is optional (generated if empty) and must be unique. Nothing will be persisted 
if transient is true. In order to trigger the pipeline either an execution ID containing valid media or base 64 encoded 
media under the media property have to be provided.

tag.description: Tag used to identify the resulting execution. Ignored if transient is true.

transient.description: Whether to delete all execution data after pipeline completion

media.description: Array of base 64 encoded media files. Content type will be detected automatically.
